title: What motivates players to deny pentakills?
body: So I'm trolling in ARAM with my full crit Assassin Nasus Build. That's when I realize my Q had AD scaling and I somehow have 500 stacks and guess what I'm one shotting people. So I go in get myself a quadrakill, theirs a low yorick who i have slowed by my W, no flash or snowball up to make a possible escape. My ally Nunu see's me with my Q which at this point one shots their squishes and half-heaths their tanks/bruiser. Yorick is at a nice 500 health. 1 of mine Q is more than enough to finish him off. Their is a clear Quadra kill the announcer even says so and I'm asbout 2-3 seconds from killing Yorick. This Nunu steals my kill and says he's reporting me. I was so close to getting my first penta and this annoying kid denies me the penta. I'm not here to complain that Rito is broken or whatever, I'm just saying what motivates players to do this, where is the humanity and the empathy?

replies.body:
In short, it's because there's no such thing as kill stealing.
It doesn't exist.

Enemy had 1 hp left and was cc'd?
Irrelevant.
Your penta wasn't stolen, you just didn't get one.

Frankly though, sometimes I think kill credit should go to whoever dealt the most damage, not who got the last hit.

> Irrelevant.
> You're penta wasn't stolen, you just didn't get one.
> 
> Frankly though, sometimes I think kill credit should go to whoever dealt the most damage, not who got the last hit.

My point isn't on Rito policies on kill stealing, although i do agree with you on that. It's about a human being saying "Hey, let me be kind and let this person get a pentakill, instead of adding an extra kill to my already trash KDA."
You can turn it around and say "instead of being selfish jerk, let me improve this guy's trash KDA instead of my trash KDA"

> [{quoted}](name=WoonStruck,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=sG2EurEs,comment-id=000500000000,timestamp=2019-08-10T03:28:44.247+0000)
>
> You can turn it around and say "instead of being selfish jerk, let me improve this guy's trash KDA instead of my trash KDA"

I had a pretty good KDA tho.
Its the rewarding feeling you get after taking it.

Because some people just wanna win the game and dont think much of pentakills... like me. Oh you wanted 5 in a row instead of 4? Big deal. Get it then. If i get the kill, oh well. Move on.

Others do want to troll of course. They think it'd be hilarious if it was so easy foryou to get it, but then some asshole comes up last second and takes it. They wanna be that asshole just for the laugh.

Then ofcourse theres the envious jealous types. They never get pentakills and they dont want someone else to have the satisfaction that they yearn for.
I remember Jatt saying it many years ago during an LCS game when someone took a penta. Earned, not given.

> [{quoted}](name=KVbqbFsC8e,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=sG2EurEs,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-08-10T01:51:34.592+0000)
>
> I remember Jatt saying it many years ago during an LCS game when someone took a penta. Earned, not given.

Pretty sure that refers to the enemy team not being obligated to jump in and die so you can get a penta, not to allies taking it upon themselves to deny teammates kill streaks. Think about it: CS, kills, etc. are earned and not given, but that doesn't justify following your allied jungler around and taking his camps while announcing ganks in /all so the enemy can hide under tower.

> [{quoted}](name=KVbqbFsC8e,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=sG2EurEs,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-08-10T01:51:34.592+0000)
>
> I remember Jatt saying it many years ago during an LCS game when someone took a penta. Earned, not given.

I kinda did earn it tho, I did the most damage in the team fight and remember I was full AD as a Nasus so I had my low range no mobility and was really squishy. I don't want to complain but it's kinda unfair how you can do 99% of the work to kill an enemy and a team mate can just stroll by and take it. I would understand if for example it's a 1 v 1 top lane you lose but your enemy is at 1% health and your jungler strolls by to secure the kill, but sometimes your doing all the work and then the feeding jungler come's in with his flashy execute mechanics and steals the kill. And then says in chat "Ez kill."

Giving someone a penta isn't expected or mandatory. 

Going out of your way to steal it is rude, and flashing to deny it is honestly stupid, but you get it yourself or not.

Side note why is he going to report you? We're you perchance toxic or AFK after he 'stole' your penta? Or was he just babyraging you went critDog?

HE wanted me to go tank not critdog so he could build AD nunu or whatever but I didn't listen. As for stealing my penta at first he was cc'ing the swain, if you looked at him it would seem he was just keeping the swain till i cam he didnt even auto attack just kept him their the second i get their and attack the swain with a few auto attacks to make sure my Q executes him, this nunu Q's him and kills him, he was obviously just trying to steal it just before i killed him. and yes it was a swain not a yorick. my bad.
I will always try my hardest to secure kills, unless I'm sup or JG and I'm trying to get someone fed.  I'm never going to go out of my way for someone to get a Penta.  Earn it, or it doesn't count.
